description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to provide seed capital to Matt Dickson to save 340 womens micro-poultry businesses from bankrupting and to keep ongoing projects afloat. Most of the funds will be used to increase the ventures value by slaughtering chickens to be used as essential product. The chicken meat will be transported to markets in the city and the leftovers will be donated to the women who have lost their chickens to hunger. This will help the womens microbusiness thrive. Eggpreneur Initiative will also deviate from door-to-door to online marketing platforms as well as purchase masks and hand sanitizers for employees to maintain safety in direct support of preventing the spread of COVID-19. The women Eggpreneurs are struggling to provide their families with food because their chicken business has collapsed. Mental health counseling will be offered to support the women during this crisis.

title.narrative: Young African Leaders Initiative (YALI) - Six Degrees Poultry

description.narrative: Having secured ample space, Six Degrees has mobilized $3,000.00 from savings towards a poultry venture in Muranga County and currently on the second lot of 1000 broiler chicken having attained an 18.33% ROI on the first harvest. Their primary goal with this project is to document while building capacity to control diseases, improved feed efficiency, handling of waste, and proper sanitizing of the poultry house for consistent growth and scale up. The farm will serve as a practical demonstration site for target beneficiaries in the surrounding counties while providing the much needed working capital to finance Six Degrees regular operations. As a business, they seek to leverage on growing partnerships with small holder farmers in other counties to extend training and investments onto other nutrient dense value chains and to profit from value addition and market linkages with demand side actors.

description.narrative: Sector: Waste Management .Beneficiaries: YAL Youth 253 of which 132 are women. ..The grant will be used to offer a complete range of solid waste services including collection, transportation and recycling. Services are offered door to door, twice per week including and customers are issued with durable black plastic bags/bins ranging from 20x30 to 36x30 to dispose their solid waste. On collection days, customers place the waste at the designated area within the building. Trained and professional garbage men will then collect and transport the waste to the nearest Garbage Sorting and Recycling Centre. At the center the garbage will be sorted into waste, recyclable and paper then converted into useful products such as flower pots, wall garden and briquettes. In the end the community will benefit socially, economically and environmentally...The grant funds will be used to: (a) establishment of a waste and recycling center; (b) purchase of briquette producing machine; (c) truck used for waste transport; (d) equipment for recycling plastic into products; and (e) hiring 1 full time and 2-part time employees. .
